Notion for personal use
Build 3 essential tools for daily life and explain how Notion can be used to support personal organization.
Personal: Creating a page
Personal: Writing and editing basics
Every Notion page is highly customizable - learn how to format text and other content blocks to your liking.
Building a personal task page
Since Notion is so flexible, you can manage your tasks however you want! But we'll show you two specific examples of task management pages that you can build yourself - one that's more lightweight, and one with more features and functionality.
Building a Journal
Whether you're an avid journalist, or making journaling a new habit, you can store your entries in Notion! We'll show you two ways to build a journal in Notion, one for beginners, and one more advanced.
Building a reading list
You stumble across interesting content every day - articles, blog posts, podcasts ... but it's hard to keep track of everything. With Notion's Web Clipper, you can stash it all in an organized database! We'll show you how to build this list from scratch.
Setting up Notion for school
We'll show you how to upgrade your workspace for free, how to set up your workspace for keeping track of notes, thesis planning, job hunting and more, as well as how to collaborate with other students.
Workspace refresh
Without proper maintenance, Notion workspaces can get messy over time. This course is designed to help you put structure and order back into your workspace.
Preparing for a refresh
Workspace Refresh course resource
Notion's Customer Success team has put together a Notion template to accompany this course. Duplicate it into your own Notion workspace and use it to follow along with the steps of the course as you refresh your own workspace.

Notion for product and engineering teams

Notion for engineers
If you‚Äôre an engineer and you‚Äôre new to Notion, you‚Äôve found the right video. We‚Äôll teach you how to create an engineering wiki and how you can set up your Notion to manage tasks and projects.
Notion for product managers
Using Notion, product managers can conduct user research, prioritize feature requests, and connect the many dots that bring their products to life.
Product and Eng: Build a team notes and docs database
It's easy for team members to help build a living record of meetings and decisions, so that anyone can find the information they need. We'll show you where to keep notes, how to build the databases that store them, and how to create dynamic links between your notes & projects.
Connecting your projects & tasks to meeting notes
Using a relation property, you can connect your projects database to the tasks and meeting notes relevant to that project ‚Äî giving your team full context for better execution.
Planning sprints for your engineering team
High-output engineering teams use Notion to plan sprints so they can better focus on the task at hand.

Notion Academy
Organize information with databases
‚Üê Notion Academy
Organize information with databases
Databases are a powerful Notion feature that can unlock your toolmaking potential. Create databases, learn about layout types, and build databases for teams.
Intro to databases
Databases in Notion are collections of pages. Here, we'll introduce you to the general structure of a database, discuss the different menus and options, and deep dive into how to open and edit pages within a database. üóÉ
Using database views
Here, we'll introduce you to the different customization options and layouts that exist once you have a database set up in your workspace.
Timeline view
Timeline is a type of Notion database that‚Äôs way more than a Gantt chart. It gives you complete flexibility to scope projects, adjust their timelines, and customize your workflow.
Table view
Tables are Notion's most traditional database view, but our tables are a lot more powerful than a grid with some rows and columns! Open each row as its own Notion page, or visualize in other database views.
Gallery view
Galleries are Notion's most visual database view. Use them to showcase beautiful photos for mood boards, team directories, vacation photos and more.
List view
Lists are Notion's most minimalist database view. All the power of a database, but without the visual clutter. Use them for meeting notes, journal entries, process documentation and more!
Board view
One of Notion's most powerful features, Boards are the best way to manage projects & tasks. Use them to group your databases by select, multiselect, and person properties.
Calendar view
Calendars are a great way to visualize dates from any database in Notion. Use them for your company's social media planning, or add a calendar view to your product management databases.
Using database templates
Instead of manually typing out the same structure and content for every new page, you can use database templates to automate your processes and save some time.
Using linked databases
Linked databases let you include synced copies of the same content across different pages. Use them to include a filtered view of team tasks in your meeting notes, or create a dashboard of tasks assigned to you from different databases.
Using advanced database filters
Managing tasks and projects in Notion just got a big upgrade. With new advanced database filters, you have even more control and customizability over your database views - make them as specific as you want for a more organized and efficient workflow.
Relation and rollup properties
Notion databases become even more powerful when you link them together. Link to a row from another database with a relation, or show a specific property from a related table with a rollup.
Notion for people ops
Explain how Notion can keep teams on the same page and be able to set up Notion for large teams using teamspaces.
Notion for HR & People operations

‚Üê Notion Academy
Scaling your team
Everything you need to know about content management and sharing in Notion. Start with a deep dive into the sidebar and page sharing, then work your way up to teamspaces and inherited permissions.
Scaling your team: Introduction
Welcome to Notion‚Äôs course on scaling your team!
Scaling your team: Page sharing
Learn how to share pages in Notion with other individuals in your workspace, or publicly as websites.
Scaling your team: Sidebar
Learn how to find pages using the sidebar and customize it to meet your needs.
Scaling your team: Office manual
Apply learnings from past videos to build and share an office manual in your team‚Äôs knowledge base.
Scaling your team: Database templates
Learn how to build and use database templates to streamline repetitive tasks.
Scaling your team: Advanced database properties
Advanced database properties can help managers and admins alike make sense of large databases ‚Äî learn how to use them in your org.
Scaling your team: Updates database
Apply what you‚Äôve learned about database templates and advanced properties to create an organized, scalable updates database for your company.
Scale your team: Building teamspaces
Create teamspaces and explain best ways to construct a sidebar for teams by comparing and contrasting methods of sidebar organization.
Scale your team: Permissions
Explain page sharing inheritance by creating a new employee onboarding resource with different access levels for different pages.
Scaling your team: Team wiki
Build a skeleton for a large team‚Äôs wiki using what you‚Äôve learned so far.
Using data
Work with large data sets in Notion including native databases, 1st party integrations, and link previews.
Using data: Introduction

Key setups for startup teams

Key setups for startup teams
Bust information silos and save valuable time and money by using Notion to replace common workplace tools. Here's just some of the tools and templates in Notion that can get your ideas off the ground.
Get started with templates
Startup in a box is a one-stop-shop to get your startup up and running, and establish the documentation and operating systems that will support you through all stages of your company‚Äôs growth.
Build a team notes and docs database
It's easy for team members to help build a living record of meetings and decisions, so that anyone can find the information they need. We'll show you where to keep notes, how to build the databases that store them, and how to create dynamic links between your notes & projects.
How to create OKRs
OKRs (objectives and key results) is a framework that helps teams set goals and keep track of their progress. With this system in Notion, you can create objectives and assign them specific key results, timelines, owners, and more.
How to build a help center
Looking for an easy, no-frills way to set up a Help Center for your growing community of users? This video will show you how to build an external Help Center in Notion, and instantly publish it to the web.
How startups can create an easy-to-update job board
Startups want to grow, but adding new roles or editing existing ones can be a bit of a pain. Notion solves this by giving teams a no code solution for hosting job listings and collecting applications.
Grow your startup with this applicant tracking system
Organization is crucial in hiring. Use Notion to tag and filter candidates based on the teams they‚Äôd join, and where they‚Äôre at in the interview process.
How startups conduct user research
Listening to users is an important part of growing your startup. With Notion, you can create a home for all your user interviews, categorize them, and connect them to your other relevant docs. Plus ‚Äî you can even make templates to standardize the interview process for anyone on your team.
Build a wiki that scales
Build a documentation system for a large company using databases and teamspaces. This course will move from creating pages to creating large databases and administrating teamspaces.
Creating a page

Creating links and backlinks
Connect your thoughts and ideas with links! Every time you make a link, Notion creates a backlink for you automatically. We'll show you how this can be helpful as you're managing tasks & projects, building a company wiki, or just taking some notes.

‚Üê Notion Academy
Getting started with templates and Marketplace
Create, list, market, and sell templates in Notion's Marketplace ‚Äî whether you‚Äôre just starting out or looking to up-level your existing template business.
Introduction to templates and Marketplace
Want to list or even sell templates in Marketplace? This course is the place to start.
Creating a Template
Building a template takes more than just Notion skill! Learn how to create templates that users will love and find valuable.
Listing a Template
It's not enough to build a great template, you have to create a good listing if you want people to find it. Learn how to create a template listing in Marketplace to entice potential users.
Building Your Creator Profile
Your creator profile is an opportunity to share your brand with the world. Learn how to create a compelling creator profile that reflects your brand and supports your template business.
Marketing your template
Looking to drive more users to your templates? Learn effective strategies to promote your template and attract potential buyers.
Selling your templates
Why do people pay for templates? How much should they cost? How do you collect your profits? Learn how to effectively price and sell your Notion templates in Marketplace.
Growing your template business
Get inspired with tips and tricks from top creators to grow and improve your template business over time ‚Äî like email collection, analytics, reviews, and more.
How to build a connected workspace
Your AI-enabled workspace becomes more powerful when it‚Äôs connected, comprehensive, and up-to-date ‚Äî create systems to get the most out of your investment.
How to build a connected workspace

Using data
‚Üê Notion Academy
Using data
Work with large data sets in Notion including native databases, 1st party integrations, and link previews.
Using data: Introduction
Welcome to Notion‚Äôs course on using data!
Using data: Intro to databases
Get started with databases, one of Notion‚Äôs most powerful features for organization, by creating a content calendar for a marketing team.
Using data: Database views
Learn how to create new layouts on databases, and sort and filter data to see exactly what you need.
Using data: Meeting notes
With your new database skills, architect a meeting notes database your whole team can operate from.
Using data: Embeds
Learn how to use embeds in Notion and incorporate Loom videos into a project plan.
Using data: Link previews
Authenticate and use link previews and learn the difference between this feature and classic embeds.
Using data: Onboarding knowledge base
Create a one-stop-shop for all new hire information that pulls in important information from all of the tools your team is using.
Using data: Automations
Install and use connections by creating a Typeform that auto-populates a Notion database.
Using data: Database sync
Learn how to sync entire databases from tools like Jira and GitHub to more centrally manage your work.
Using data: Integrated project management
Create a living project hub for an upcoming product launch that combines Notion data, as well as data from third party apps.
Key setups for startup teams
Bust information silos and save valuable time and money by using Notion to replace common workplace tools. Here's just some of the tools and templates in Notion that can get your ideas off the ground.
Get started with templates

Workspace refresh
‚Üê Notion Academy
Workspace refresh
Without proper maintenance, Notion workspaces can get messy over time. This course is designed to help you put structure and order back into your workspace.
Preparing for a refresh
Learn what's involved with a workspace refresh, including the scope, timeline, and team communications.
Understanding the current state of the workspace
Learn how teamspaces and the workspace owner role can bring structure to your workspace.
Establishing documentation and archival strategies
Learn about Notion's Wiki feature and some best practices for archiving outdated content.
Finding and moving content
Learn how to find high-traffic pages with analytics, then move them within the workspace using content search.
Building a company homepage
Build a homepage for your company and learn to differentiate between company-wide and team-specific content.
Auditing the sidebar
Learn what content belongs on the sidebar, and begin filing top-level pages into their relevant teamspaces.
Notion for Enterprise Admins
Everything you need to deploy and manage Notion across your organization as an Admin.
Notion Admin Overview

101: Introduction
Blocks
‚Üê Notion Academy
Blocks
Blocks are the basic unit of construction in Notion. Learn how 500+ block types come together to create beautiful, custom tools.
Uh-oh! It looks like your ad blocker is preventing the video from playing.
Blocks are the way you build in Notion. Everything that sits on a page is a block including text, images, and tables.
You can mix and match different blocks to create unique pages and tools for your team.
There are six main block categories (and over 500 blocks types) in Notion:
Basic blocks
Basic blocks
Database
Database
Media
Media
Embeds
Embeds
Advanced blocks
Advanced blocks
In-line options
In-line options

Assignment
Customize your team‚Äôs vision and mission page, ourtemplateis just the beginning.
SOP document
Apply your new knowledge about blocks and editing to build a standard operating procedure doc for your team.

Build a team notes and docs database

Assignment
Teamdocsandmeeting notes!
How to create OKRs
OKRs (objectives and key results) is a framework that helps teams set goals and keep track of their progress. With this system in Notion, you can create objectives and assign them specific key results, timelines, owners, and more.

How to build a website in Notion
Building a Website with Notion
‚Üê Notion Academy
Building a Website with Notion
Build a website starting with a template, understand the blocks that can be used, and customize your Site to suit your needs.
Uh-oh! It looks like your ad blocker is preventing the video from playing.
Notion allows you to create a website quickly and easily without any coding required. You can build a landing page, portfolio, or help center using Notion‚Äôs powerful building blocks.
Notion allows you to create a website quickly and easily without any coding required. You can build a landing page, portfolio, or help center using Notion‚Äôs powerful building blocks.
Notion offers a variety of pre-built site templates to help you get started quickly. For example, the Personal Website template can be customized extensively.
Notion offers a variety of pre-built site templates to help you get started quickly. For example, the Personal Website template can be customized extensively.
To personalize your site, you can embed visual elements like photographs or videos, add custom sections using headings, and use Notion‚Äôs AI writing capabilities to craft content.
To personalize your site, you can embed visual elements like photographs or videos, add custom sections using headings, and use Notion‚Äôs AI writing capabilities to craft content.

Getting started with templates and Marketplace
Creating a Template
‚Üê Notion Academy
Creating a Template
Building a template takes more than just Notion skill! Learn how to create templates that users will love and find valuable.
Uh-oh! It looks like your ad blocker is preventing the video from playing.
Start by finding a system that works well for you, then tailor it to a specific audience, leveraging your unique skills and knowledge to create a template that fills a gap in the market ‚Äî it's all about solving real problems for real people!
Start by finding a system that works well for you, then tailor it to a specific audience, leveraging your unique skills and knowledge to create a template that fills a gap in the market ‚Äî it's all about solving real problems for real people!
Types of templates and their characteristics:One-pagers: Simple, user-friendly worksheets (e.g., SWOT analysis)Sites: Content-focused templates, often in-depth resources on specific topicsWorkflows: Templates for specific tasks or processes (e.g., OKR tracking)Dashboards: Comprehensive systems integrating multiple aspects of work or life
Types of templates and their characteristics:
One-pagers: Simple, user-friendly worksheets (e.g., SWOT analysis)
One-pagers: Simple, user-friendly worksheets (e.g., SWOT analysis)
Sites: Content-focused templates, often in-depth resources on specific topics
Sites: Content-focused templates, often in-depth resources on specific topics
Workflows: Templates for specific tasks or processes (e.g., OKR tracking)
Workflows: Templates for specific tasks or processes (e.g., OKR tracking)
Dashboards: Comprehensive systems integrating multiple aspects of work or life
Dashboards: Comprehensive systems integrating multiple aspects of work or life
Considerations for template design:Thoroughly test your template before submitting. Check for errors, typos, and functionality across different scenarios.Consider the user experience when designing your template. Add instructional materials like videos, callouts, or a getting started page to help users navigate and use your template effectively. This reduces the learning curve and improves user adoption.Ensure scalability for teams and long-term use by adding filtered views and toggles to organize content over time or mutli-player use.Don't forget the basics! Double-check your spelling, grammar, and examples. Also, make sure to remove any personal information (like banking details) before sharing your template.
Considerations for template design:
Thoroughly test your template before submitting. Check for errors, typos, and functionality across different scenarios.
Thoroughly test your template before submitting. Check for errors, typos, and functionality across different scenarios.
Consider the user experience when designing your template. Add instructional materials like videos, callouts, or a getting started page to help users navigate and use your template effectively. This reduces the learning curve and improves user adoption.
Consider the user experience when designing your template. Add instructional materials like videos, callouts, or a getting started page to help users navigate and use your template effectively. This reduces the learning curve and improves user adoption.
Ensure scalability for teams and long-term use by adding filtered views and toggles to organize content over time or mutli-player use.
Ensure scalability for teams and long-term use by adding filtered views and toggles to organize content over time or mutli-player use.
Don't forget the basics! Double-check your spelling, grammar, and examples. Also, make sure to remove any personal information (like banking details) before sharing your template.
Don't forget the basics! Double-check your spelling, grammar, and examples. Also, make sure to remove any personal information (like banking details) before sharing your template.
Make sure you've turned your template into aNotion Siteby toggling on theDuplicate as templateoption.
Make sure you've turned your template into aNotion Siteby toggling on theDuplicate as templateoption.

Assignment
Now that you've learned the key aspects of creating a great template, it's time to turn your idea into reality! Take the first step today by outlining your template concept and start building something amazing that will help others boost their productivity.
Listing a Template
It's not enough to build a great template, you have to create a good listing if you want people to find it. Learn how to create a template listing in Marketplace to entice potential users.

Introduction to templates and Marketplace
Want to list or even sell templates in Marketplace? This course is the place to start.
Uh-oh! It looks like your ad blocker is preventing the video from playing.
ANotion templateis a pre-designed page or set of pages that users can duplicate and customize for their own workflows ‚Äî serving as inspiration, speeding up setup, and potentially improving efficiency for businesses.
ANotion templateis a pre-designed page or set of pages that users can duplicate and customize for their own workflows ‚Äî serving as inspiration, speeding up setup, and potentially improving efficiency for businesses.
The course aims to equip users with knowledge and skills to create, list, market, and sell successful templates in Notion's marketplace.
The course aims to equip users with knowledge and skills to create, list, market, and sell successful templates in Notion's marketplace.
Anyone can be a template creator ‚Äî a company, a content creator, a student, or a professional. The key is being comfortable working and building in Notion.
Anyone can be a template creator ‚Äî a company, a content creator, a student, or a professional. The key is being comfortable working and building in Notion.

Learn about Notion's Wiki feature and some best practices for archiving outdated content.
Uh-oh! It looks like your ad blocker is preventing the video from playing.
- Auditing a workspace in Notion involves understanding how a company organizes knowledge on the platform and taking note of existing teamspaces and their content.- Teampspaces in Notion are used to separate different types of content or workflows within a workspace and their implementation should be planned.- It's important to ensure workspace members have the correct level of administrative access, with workspace owner being the highest level of administrator privilege.- Settings can be adjusted to control who can create new teamspaces and who can edit top-level pages of teamspaces.- Communication with the company about changes being implemented is key.
Assignment
Notion's Customer Success team has put together a Notion template to accompany this course. Duplicate it into your own Notion workspace and use it to follow along with the steps of the course as you refresh your own workspace.
Duplicate the template here
Finding and moving content
Learn how to find high-traffic pages with analytics, then move them within the workspace using content search.

Getting started with Notion AI
Getting to know Notion AI
‚Üê Notion Academy
Getting to know Notion AI
Welcome to our course that's all about getting started with Notion AI! In this video, you'll get a glimpse of what's to come in this course. Plus, learn how to access Notion AI, and when to use it for maximum impact.
Uh-oh! It looks like your ad blocker is preventing the video from playing.
What is Notion AI?
Notion AI is your connected assistant that works alongside you in your workspace. Unlike standalone AI tools, it understands both your content and context, making it uniquely powerful for your specific needs. It can help you write better, work more efficiently, and generate new ideas ‚Äì all without leaving your workflow.
Notion AI excels in three main areas:
Search:Quickly find and extract information from across your workspace and connected tools, saving hours of manual searching.
Search:
Quickly find and extract information from across your workspace and connected tools, saving hours of manual searching.
Writing:Create and refine content with AI-powered suggestions, from fixing grammar to improving clarity and style.
Writing:
Create and refine content with AI-powered suggestions, from fixing grammar to improving clarity and style.
Project Management:Streamline workflows with AI assistance for task filing, progress tracking, and project documentation.
Project Management:
Streamline workflows with AI assistance for task filing, progress tracking, and project documentation.
How to access Notion AI
Like all the best assistants, Notion AI is right where you need it‚Äîintegrated right into your workflow.
Start a new line and pressspaceto bring up AI options
Start a new line and pressspaceto bring up AI options
Find the AI icon in the formatting toolbar when editing existing text
Find the AI icon in the formatting toolbar when editing existing text
Access the AI chat from the bottom-right corner for more complex queries
Access the AI chat from the bottom-right corner for more complex queries
Use AI features on mobile through the assistant icon
Use AI features on mobile through the assistant icon

Searching with Notion AI
Use Notion AI's search capabilities to effortlessly find and synthesize information across your workspace and connected apps.

How to create OKRs
‚Üê Notion Academy
How to create OKRs
OKRs (objectives and key results) is a framework that helps teams set goals and keep track of their progress. With this system in Notion, you can create objectives and assign them specific key results, timelines, owners, and more.

Getting started with templates and Marketplace
Listing a Template
‚Üê Notion Academy
Listing a Template
It's not enough to build a great template, you have to create a good listing if you want people to find it. Learn how to create a template listing in Marketplace to entice potential users.
Uh-oh! It looks like your ad blocker is preventing the video from playing.
Components of a template listingTitle: Make it descriptive and specific to help users understand what your template offers.Description: Keep it humble and focused. Share what's in the template, not just marketing words.Categories: Choose appropriate categories to help users find your template.Screenshots: Include 3-5 high-quality screenshots or even videos showcasing different parts of your template.
Components of a template listing
Title: Make it descriptive and specific to help users understand what your template offers.
Title: Make it descriptive and specific to help users understand what your template offers.
Description: Keep it humble and focused. Share what's in the template, not just marketing words.
Description: Keep it humble and focused. Share what's in the template, not just marketing words.
Categories: Choose appropriate categories to help users find your template.
Categories: Choose appropriate categories to help users find your template.
Screenshots: Include 3-5 high-quality screenshots or even videos showcasing different parts of your template.
Screenshots: Include 3-5 high-quality screenshots or even videos showcasing different parts of your template.
Taking great screenshotsUse screenshots to highlight unique features or selling points of your template, making it more appealing to potential users.Consider adding links to YouTube videos in your listing to provide a more comprehensive view of your template and increase its appeal to users.
Taking great screenshots
Use screenshots to highlight unique features or selling points of your template, making it more appealing to potential users.
Use screenshots to highlight unique features or selling points of your template, making it more appealing to potential users.
Consider adding links to YouTube videos in your listing to provide a more comprehensive view of your template and increase its appeal to users.
Consider adding links to YouTube videos in your listing to provide a more comprehensive view of your template and increase its appeal to users.
Template review can take up to 2 weeks. Common reasons templates get rejected include:Inaccessible or unsupported purchase URLTemplate duplication not enabledPoor image quality or incomplete contentAI-generated content that doesn't qualify as a true templateUse of "Notion" or "template" in the titleSubmission in unsupported languages
Template review can take up to 2 weeks. Common reasons templates get rejected include:
Inaccessible or unsupported purchase URL
Inaccessible or unsupported purchase URL
Template duplication not enabled
Template duplication not enabled
Poor image quality or incomplete content
Poor image quality or incomplete content
AI-generated content that doesn't qualify as a true template
AI-generated content that doesn't qualify as a true template
Use of "Notion" or "template" in the title
Use of "Notion" or "template" in the title
Submission in unsupported languages
Submission in unsupported languages
Read the terms and guidelines for using Marketplacehere.
Read the terms and guidelines for using Marketplacehere.

Assignment
Now that you've learned about the key components of an effective template listing, it's time to create one for your own template. Draft a title, description, and list of categories for your template. Then, take screenshots that showcase its best features. Remember to review the common rejection reasons to ensure your listing meets all the requirements.

Notion Academy
Workspace refresh
Preparing for a refresh
‚Üê Notion Academy
Preparing for a refresh
Learn what's involved with a workspace refresh, including the scope, timeline, and team communications.
Uh-oh! It looks like your ad blocker is preventing the video from playing.
- Auditing a workspace in Notion involves understanding how a company organizes knowledge on the platform and taking note of existing teamspaces and their content.- Teampspaces in Notion are used to separate different types of content or workflows within a workspace and their implementation should be planned.- It's important to ensure workspace members have the correct level of administrative access, with workspace owner being the highest level of administrator privilege.- Settings can be adjusted to control who can create new teamspaces and who can edit top-level pages of teamspaces.- Communication with the company about changes being implemented is key.

Assignment
Notion's Customer Success team has put together a Notion template to accompany this course. Duplicate it into your own Notion workspace and use it to follow along with the steps of the course as you refresh your own workspace.
Duplicate the template here

Learn how teamspaces and the workspace owner role can bring structure to your workspace.

How to build a website in Notion
Publishing Notion pages to the web
‚Üê Notion Academy
Publishing Notion pages to the web
Publish a Notion page to the web in just a few clicks, and learn how to configure basic settings in the publish menu.
Uh-oh! It looks like your ad blocker is preventing the video from playing.
Publish a Notion page to the web by navigating to theSharemenu, selecting thePublishtab, and clicking thePublishbutton.
Publish a Notion page to the web by navigating to theSharemenu, selecting thePublishtab, and clicking thePublishbutton.
Configure basic settings in the publish menu, including setting up a custom domain, enabling SEO indexing, and setting link expirations.
Configure basic settings in the publish menu, including setting up a custom domain, enabling SEO indexing, and setting link expirations.
Once published, the Notion page will have a public URL that can be shared with others, making it accessible to anyone on the web. You can change the domain in the ‚ÄúSettings‚Äù menu.
Once published, the Notion page will have a public URL that can be shared with others, making it accessible to anyone on the web. You can change the domain in the ‚ÄúSettings‚Äù menu.
Any changes made to the Notion page will automatically reflect on the public version, ensuring the content is always up-to-date.
Any changes made to the Notion page will automatically reflect on the public version, ensuring the content is always up-to-date.

Customizing your Notion Site
Personalize your Notion site with visual customizations and editable link previews in the "Site customizations" menu.

Scaling your team
Scaling your team: Page sharing
‚Üê Notion Academy
Scaling your team: Page sharing
Learn how to share pages in Notion with other individuals in your workspace, or publicly as websites.
Uh-oh! It looks like your ad blocker is preventing the video from playing.
Any pages in the teamspaces section will be accessible to everyone in that teamspace. This can be useful for transparency and keeping everyone on the same page.
There are sections in your sidebar:Teamspaces: pages shared with everyone in a teamspace.Shared: pages shared by or with you, but not everyone.Private: pages only you can see.
There are sections in your sidebar:
Teamspaces: pages shared with everyone in a teamspace.
Teamspaces: pages shared with everyone in a teamspace.
Shared: pages shared by or with you, but not everyone.
Shared: pages shared by or with you, but not everyone.
Private: pages only you can see.
Private: pages only you can see.
To share a private page with individual members, use theSharebutton.
To share a private page with individual members, use theSharebutton.
You canFavoriteitems to have them appear at the top of your sidebar.
You canFavoriteitems to have them appear at the top of your sidebar.

Assignment
Shared one on one docs are a great way for managers and reports to stay connected. Get started with thetemplate.

Scaling your team: Sidebar

Scaling your team: Sidebar
Learn how to find pages using the sidebar and customize it to meet your needs.
Uh-oh! It looks like your ad blocker is preventing the video from playing.
In Notion, pages can house other pages. You can see nested pages by clicking the dropdown on any page in your sidebar.
All content in Notion, lives on a page.
All content in Notion, lives on a page.
To tell where a page lives, you can look at the breadcrumbs at the top of the page.
To tell where a page lives, you can look at the breadcrumbs at the top of the page.
We recommend having a company operating systems page and a page in the sidebar for every major function on your team.Like marketing, design, or engineering. Within those pages, you can further categorize as needed.
We recommend having a company operating systems page and a page in the sidebar for every major function on your team.
Like marketing, design, or engineering. Within those pages, you can further categorize as needed.
Like marketing, design, or engineering. Within those pages, you can further categorize as needed.

Getting started with Notion AI
Searching with Notion AI
‚Üê Notion Academy
Searching with Notion AI
Use Notion AI's search capabilities to effortlessly find and synthesize information across your workspace and connected apps.
Uh-oh! It looks like your ad blocker is preventing the video from playing.
Notion AI search is more powerful than traditional search because itunderstands contextandcan synthesize information across multiple connected apps
Notion AI search is more powerful than traditional search because itunderstands contextandcan synthesize information across multiple connected apps
Three main use cases for AI search:Process questions‚Äî helps new employees quickly locate important information about company policies, procedures, and workflows without having to ask colleaguesProject questions‚Äî enables you to gather context from multiple sources like Slack, Google Drive, and GitHub to get a complete picture of project status and requirementsQuick recall‚Äî instantly surfaces specific information like stats from past presentations or details from meeting notes, saving time spent searching through files
Three main use cases for AI search:
Process questions‚Äî helps new employees quickly locate important information about company policies, procedures, and workflows without having to ask colleagues
Process questions‚Äî helps new employees quickly locate important information about company policies, procedures, and workflows without having to ask colleagues
Project questions‚Äî enables you to gather context from multiple sources like Slack, Google Drive, and GitHub to get a complete picture of project status and requirements
Project questions‚Äî enables you to gather context from multiple sources like Slack, Google Drive, and GitHub to get a complete picture of project status and requirements
Quick recall‚Äî instantly surfaces specific information like stats from past presentations or details from meeting notes, saving time spent searching through files
Quick recall‚Äî instantly surfaces specific information like stats from past presentations or details from meeting notes, saving time spent searching through files
Setting up AI search requires either connecting external apps like Slack, Google Drive, GitHub, and Jira or importing information directly into Notion
Setting up AI search requires either connecting external apps like Slack, Google Drive, GitHub, and Jira or importing information directly into Notion
The source picker allows users to narrow down search results to specific apps or areas, making it easier to find relevant information
The source picker allows users to narrow down search results to specific apps or areas, making it easier to find relevant information
AI search respects existing permissions, provides citations to sources, and eliminates the need to interrupt colleagues for basic information
AI search respects existing permissions, provides citations to sources, and eliminates the need to interrupt colleagues for basic information

Writing with Notion AI
Learn how to use AI to enhance your writing at every stage of the process, from research and outlining to drafting and polishing your work.

Table view
Tables are Notion's most traditional database view, but our tables are a lot more powerful than a grid with some rows and columns! Open each row as its own Notion page, or visualize in other database views.

Understanding the current state of the workspace
‚Üê Notion Academy
Understanding the current state of the workspace
Learn how teamspaces and the workspace owner role can bring structure to your workspace.
Uh-oh! It looks like your ad blocker is preventing the video from playing.
- Auditing a workspace in Notion involves understanding how a company organizes knowledge on the platform and taking note of existing teamspaces and their content.- Teampspaces in Notion are used to separate different types of content or workflows within a workspace and their implementation should be planned.- It's important to ensure workspace members have the correct level of administrative access, with workspace owner being the highest level of administrator privilege.- Settings can be adjusted to control who can create new teamspaces and who can edit top-level pages of teamspaces.- Communication with the company about changes being implemented is key.

Learn how to create new layouts on databases, and sort and filter data to see exactly what you need.
Uh-oh! It looks like your ad blocker is preventing the video from playing.
When you first create a database, you'll need to choose the layout of the default view. After this, you'll see the option to create additional views as tabs, with the+button. Your database can have as many views as you want!
Give your view a name in the text box, and choose the type of layout you want.
Give your view a name in the text box, and choose the type of layout you want.
When you have multiple views, you'll see them listed across the top of your database as tabs.
When you have multiple views, you'll see them listed across the top of your database as tabs.
There are six different ways to visualize your content within a database. Here's a high level overview of each layout:
Table
Table
Board
Board
Timeline
Timeline
Calendar
Calendar
List
List
Gallery
Gallery

Using data
Using data: Intro to databases
‚Üê Notion Academy
Using data: Intro to databases
Get started with databases, one of Notion‚Äôs most powerful features for organization, by creating a content calendar for a marketing team.
Uh-oh! It looks like your ad blocker is preventing the video from playing.
Databases might look like the typical spreadsheet, but they‚Äôre way more powerful. Unlike spreadsheets, databases can be filled with dynamic, relational data.
Notion databases have many different properties, which can label pieces of data.Some unique property types include dates, emails, and URLs.These properties can be used to sort and filter the information in your database.
Notion databases have many different properties, which can label pieces of data.
Some unique property types include dates, emails, and URLs.
Some unique property types include dates, emails, and URLs.
These properties can be used to sort and filter the information in your database.
These properties can be used to sort and filter the information in your database.
Each database entry is also it‚Äôs own page.
Each database entry is also it‚Äôs own page.
Database blocks can either be created in-line or as their own page.
Database blocks can either be created in-line or as their own page.

How to build a connected workspace
What‚Äôs in a connected workspace?
‚Üê Notion Academy
What‚Äôs in a connected workspace?
The ideal connected workspace organizes specific types of knowledge. To understand and apply these concepts in practice, explore the sidebar and create a new teamspace.
Uh-oh! It looks like your ad blocker is preventing the video from playing.
Your workspace should have two kinds of teamspaces ‚Äî General (for everyone, company-wide) and team-specific (one for each team‚Ä¶ marketing, product, etc.)
Your workspace should have two kinds of teamspaces ‚Äî General (for everyone, company-wide) and team-specific (one for each team‚Ä¶ marketing, product, etc.)
Each kind of teamspace houses different knowledge types.General teamspace ‚Üí Docs, Meetings, Wiki, and FAQsTeam teamspace‚Äôs ‚Üí Wiki, FAQs, Project trackers
Each kind of teamspace houses different knowledge types.
General teamspace ‚Üí Docs, Meetings, Wiki, and FAQs
General teamspace ‚Üí Docs, Meetings, Wiki, and FAQs
Team teamspace‚Äôs ‚Üí Wiki, FAQs, Project trackers
Team teamspace‚Äôs ‚Üí Wiki, FAQs, Project trackers
Databases are the key to organizing and managing different types of knowledge.
Databases are the key to organizing and managing different types of knowledge.

Write and edit text
Learn how to create and edit pages in Notion by making a simple personal task list.
Uh-oh! It looks like your ad blocker is preventing the video from playing.
Every page you create in Notion is a fresh canvas where you can add whatever content you want.
When you open a new page, just start typing. You‚Äôll notice other features fade away so you can focus on getting your thoughts on the page.
Create sections using headings likeH1,H2orH3.
Create sections using headings likeH1,H2orH3.
Highlight any text to bring up a menu of options and tools. From here you can style your text, add a hyperlink and more.
Highlight any text to bring up a menu of options and tools. From here you can style your text, add a hyperlink and more.
Or, format text using markdown syntax to style without ever moving your mouse.Add atoggle listto hide less important information.Try columns to split up content.Add adividerto help organize your sections.
Or, format text using markdown syntax to style without ever moving your mouse.
Add atoggle listto hide less important information.
Add atoggle listto hide less important information.
Try columns to split up content.
Try columns to split up content.
Add adividerto help organize your sections.
Add adividerto help organize your sections.

Getting started with Notion AI
Writing with Notion AI
‚Üê Notion Academy
Writing with Notion AI
Learn how to use AI to enhance your writing at every stage of the process, from research and outlining to drafting and polishing your work.
Uh-oh! It looks like your ad blocker is preventing the video from playing.
Rather than relying on AI to generate complete drafts, use it strategically throughout your writing process to enhance research, organization, and refinement while maintaining your unique voice and creative control.Research ‚ÄîNotion AI's search capabilities help you quickly gather context from across your workspace, making research more efficient by surfacing relevant information from multiple sources.Outlining ‚ÄîAI assists in creating document templates and organizing notes into structured outlines, with the ability to incorporate existing templates from your workspace through @-mentions.Drafting ‚ÄîRather than generating entire documents at once, Notion AI excels at transforming bullet points into coherent paragraphs and adapting content to match specific requirements.Making improvements ‚ÄîThe AI can rewrite content to match your organization's style guides and templates, ensuring consistency across documents while maintaining the original message.Final Polishing ‚ÄîOne-click writing skills help with grammar, spelling, and readability improvements, while also offering translation capabilities for global teams.
Rather than relying on AI to generate complete drafts, use it strategically throughout your writing process to enhance research, organization, and refinement while maintaining your unique voice and creative control.
Research ‚ÄîNotion AI's search capabilities help you quickly gather context from across your workspace, making research more efficient by surfacing relevant information from multiple sources.
Research ‚ÄîNotion AI's search capabilities help you quickly gather context from across your workspace, making research more efficient by surfacing relevant information from multiple sources.
Outlining ‚ÄîAI assists in creating document templates and organizing notes into structured outlines, with the ability to incorporate existing templates from your workspace through @-mentions.
Outlining ‚ÄîAI assists in creating document templates and organizing notes into structured outlines, with the ability to incorporate existing templates from your workspace through @-mentions.
Drafting ‚ÄîRather than generating entire documents at once, Notion AI excels at transforming bullet points into coherent paragraphs and adapting content to match specific requirements.
Drafting ‚ÄîRather than generating entire documents at once, Notion AI excels at transforming bullet points into coherent paragraphs and adapting content to match specific requirements.
Making improvements ‚ÄîThe AI can rewrite content to match your organization's style guides and templates, ensuring consistency across documents while maintaining the original message.
Making improvements ‚ÄîThe AI can rewrite content to match your organization's style guides and templates, ensuring consistency across documents while maintaining the original message.
Final Polishing ‚ÄîOne-click writing skills help with grammar, spelling, and readability improvements, while also offering translation capabilities for global teams.
Final Polishing ‚ÄîOne-click writing skills help with grammar, spelling, and readability improvements, while also offering translation capabilities for global teams.
Create style guides that define your brand voice and formatting to help AI generate consistent, on-brand content.
Create style guides that define your brand voice and formatting to help AI generate consistent, on-brand content.

AI-powered projects
Use Notion AI as your productivity sidekick in projects ‚Äì from automatically summarizing meeting notes to tagging tasks by priority, AI can help you focus on the work that matters most.

‚Üê Notion AI
Notion AI connector for GitHub
Learn how to unlock your GitHub knowledge in Notion AI ü§ñ
Who can connect GitHub to Notion AI?
How do I connect my GitHub organization?
If you're a Notion workspace owner and GitHub owner
If you're a Notion workspace member
What content from GitHub can be connected to Notion AI?
Best practices and example prompts
Where can I use my Notion AI connector for GitHub?
FAQs

Note:This feature is only available for users on the Business Plan or Enterprise Plan.
Who can connect GitHub to Notion AI?
To connect GitHub to Notion AI:
You must be a GitHub organization owner and Notion workspace owner.
You must be a GitHub organization owner and Notion workspace owner.
Your workspace must be on the Business or Enterprise Plan and have more than one member.
Your workspace must be on the Business or Enterprise Plan and have more than one member.
Once the connection is made, members of your Notion workspace must log in to access the repositories that they have access to.
How do I connect my GitHub organization?
If you're a Notion workspace owner and GitHub owner
To connect GitHub to your Notion workspace:
Go toSettings‚ÜíNotion AI.
Go toSettings‚ÜíNotion AI.
Select+next toGitHub.
Select+next toGitHub.
You'll be taken to GitHub. Make sure you're logged in with the correct GitHub account.Don't close Notion during the setup process!
You'll be taken to GitHub. Make sure you're logged in with the correct GitHub account.Don't close Notion during the setup process!
In the page that opens, connect to GitHub and select the organization you want to sync. Note that if you want to connect a personal GitHub repository, you must first create an organization and then move the repository into the organization.
In the page that opens, connect to GitHub and select the organization you want to sync. Note that if you want to connect a personal GitHub repository, you must first create an organization and then move the repository into the organization.
SelectAll repositories(recommended) orSelect repositories, then selectInstall.
SelectAll repositories(recommended) orSelect repositories, then selectInstall.
Return to Notion.
Return to Notion.
Once the integration is set up, it will be able to index PRs and issues going back a year from when the setup is complete. You‚Äôll also have access to all code files including markdown files and READMes with no time restrictions.

Note:At this time, wikis andforked repositoriesaren‚Äôt supported.
It can take up to 72 hours for the connection to complete. Afterwards, each user in your Notion workspace must authenticate with GitHub individually to use the integration, and their permissions will be mapped accordingly.
If you're a Notion workspace member
If you aren‚Äôt the owner of your Notion workspace or your GitHub organization, you‚Äôll need an owner to connect Notion with GitHub first before you can use the integration. Once the integration has been set up by an owner, you‚Äôll have to log in to connect your private repositories. To do this:
In Notion, openNotion AIat the bottom of your screen and click on‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚ÜíConnect GitHub.
In Notion, openNotion AIat the bottom of your screen and click on‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚ÜíConnect GitHub.
SelectLog Inand connect your GitHub account.
SelectLog Inand connect your GitHub account.
What content from GitHub can be connected to Notion AI?
Each user will only be able to use Notion AI to see and search content that they have access to in GitHub. Notion AI can retrieve the past year's worth of information from PRs.
Best practices and example prompts
The GitHub AI connector is most helpful for:
Asking about recent changes and project updates.
Asking about recent changes and project updates.
Finding code implementations.
Finding code implementations.
Looking up issues and their status.
Looking up issues and their status.
Debugging issues. For example, you can get context when features are broken or throwing errors by reading through recent PRs.
Debugging issues. For example, you can get context when features are broken or throwing errors by reading through recent PRs.
Finding security patterns.
Finding security patterns.
You could try prompting Notion AI with the following:
"What's the latest with {project name}?"
"What's the latest with {project name}?"
"Which pull requests did we work on over the past week?"
"Which pull requests did we work on over the past week?"
"What are the recent changes to our authentication system?"
"What are the recent changes to our authentication system?"
"Show me examples of how we're implementing error handling in our codebase."
"Show me examples of how we're implementing error handling in our codebase."
"What are the main dependencies used in our frontend components?"
"What are the main dependencies used in our frontend components?"
"Find implementations of the database migration functions."
"Find implementations of the database migration functions."
"What security patterns are we using for API endpoints?‚Äù
"What security patterns are we using for API endpoints?‚Äù
Where can I use my Notion AI connector for GitHub?
You can search GitHub via Notion AI connectors in the following places:
The Notion AI chat in the bottom right of Notion.
The Notion AI chat in the bottom right of Notion.
The Notion AI widget at the top ofHome.
The Notion AI widget at the top ofHome.
Searchin your sidebar.
Searchin your sidebar.
You can narrow your search to just GitHub by opening theAll sourcestoggle in chat andHomeand selectingGitHub. You can also filter Notion AISearchresults to show only information from GitHub.
FAQs
Who can connect GitHub to Notion AI?
When connecting GitHub to Notion AI for the first time, you must be a Notion workspace owneranda GitHub organization owner. Once the connection is made, members of your Notion workspace must log in to access repositories that they have access to.
I connected the wrong Notion workspace. How can I disconnect my GitHub Repository?
Workspace owners may disconnect or edit channels after the initial integration is complete by going toSettings‚ÜíNotion AI. Select‚öôÔ∏ènext toGitHub‚ÜíSettings‚ÜíDisconnect.
How long does it take for the integration to complete?
Setting up the integration can take up to 72 hours depending on the size of the repository and GitHub plan type.
How long does it take for new content in GitHub to be reflected in Notion AI?
After the initial setup, we will index new data every 30 minutes.
Can everyone in my Notion workspace access information from GitHub?
Members in a workspace must authenticate and log in individually to retrieve information from private repositories that they already have access to in GitHub.
How far back can I ask questions about in GitHub?
You can retrieve up to one year‚Äôs worth of PRs and issues in their repository. All READMes will be available without any time restrictions.
Do Notion AI connectors respect existing Notion AI permissions?
Absolutely. Notion AI will honor existing permissions according to our existingNotion AI Security Practices. Users will not be able to generate content or receive Notion AI responses based on third-party resources they do not have access to.
How does Notion AI handle permissions mapping?
Notion AI for GitHub maps GitHub members to Notion members. The user must be both a GitHub and Notion member to authenticate this app at the user level. We sync permissions from GitHub every hour and update permissions in Notion accordingly.
How is Notion storing or referencing my GitHub data in its systems?
Similar to our core Notion AI product, we store create and store embeddings in a vector database hosted by Turbopuffer, which powers the ability to provide responses to questions that leverage third party content (e.g., GitHub). Turbopuffer has been vetted by our security team as well as an external auditor to obtain their SOC2 Type II certification.Learn more about Turbopuffer‚Äôs security here ‚Üí

Learn more

Notion AI connector for Slack

Who can connect Jira to Notion AI?
How do I connect my Jira site?
What content from Jira can be connected to Notion AI?
Best practices and example prompts
Where can I use my Notion AI connector for Jira?
FAQs

Where can I use my Notion AI connector for Jira?
You can search Jira via Notion AI connectors in the following places:
The Notion AI chat in the bottom right of Notion.
The Notion AI chat in the bottom right of Notion.
The Notion AI widget at the top ofHome.
The Notion AI widget at the top ofHome.
Searchin your sidebar.
Searchin your sidebar.
You can narrow your search to just Jira by opening theAll sourcestoggle in chat andHomeand selectingJira. You can also filter Notion AISearchresults to show only information from Jira.

Note:Notion AI isn't meant to run complex analytics or perform math on large data sets. For example, it won't be able to tell you how many tickets were created in the last month. Try asking questions about specific projects or issues.
FAQs
Does the Jira AI connector support filters?
No, the Jira AI connector does not support dashboards or filters at this time.
I connected the wrong Notion workspace. How can I disconnect my Jira site?
Workspace owners can disconnect projects after the initial integration is complete by going toSettings‚ÜíNotion AI. Select‚öôÔ∏ènext toJira‚ÜíSettings‚ÜíDisconnect.
How long does it take for the integration to complete?
Setting up the integration can take up to 36 hours depending on the size of the Jira site.
How long does it take for new content from Jira to reflect in Notion AI?
We will start indexing new data as soon as 30 minutes and can take up to 36 hours for full indexing.
Can everyone in the Notion workspace access information from Jira?
Members in a workspace will only have access to retrieve information from Jira if they have access to the Jira site. If additional permissions are set on a project or issues level, users will only be able to ask questions to those that they have access to.
How far back in Jira can I ask questions about?
The integration will be able to find information going back a year.
Does Notion AI respect existing Notion AI permissions?
Absolutely. Notion AI will honor existing permissions according to our existingNotion AI Security Practices. Users will not be able to generate content or receive responses based on resources they do not have access to. Specific to third party content, Notion AI is handling both private and public content with security in mind, only ingesting content according to the permissions mapping between Jira and Notion users.
How does Notion AI handle permissions mapping?
Notion AI for Jira maps Jira members to Notion members. The user must be both a Jira and Notion member to authenticate this app at the user level. Every hour, we periodically sync permissions from Jira and update the permissions in Notion.
How is Notion storing or referencing my Jira data in its systems?
We store create and store embeddings in a vector database hosted by Turbopuffer, which powers the ability to provide responses to questions that leverage third party content (like in Jira). Turbopuffer has been vetted by our security team as well as an external auditor to obtain their SOC2 Type II certification.Learn more about Turbopuffer‚Äôs security here ‚Üí

Who can connect Linear to Notion AI?
How do I connect Linear?
FAQs
Who can connect Linear to Notion AI?
To connect Linear to Notion AI:
You must be a Linear Workspace admin.
You must be a Linear Workspace admin.
You must be a Notion workspace owner.
You must be a Notion workspace owner.
Your workspace must be on the Business or Enterprise Plan.
Your workspace must be on the Business or Enterprise Plan.
How do I connect Linear?
To connect Linear to your Notion workspace:
In Notion, navigate to the Linear AI Connector by going toSettings‚ÜíNotion AI‚ÜíLinearin the AI Connectors section.
In Notion, navigate to the Linear AI Connector by going toSettings‚ÜíNotion AI‚ÜíLinearin the AI Connectors section.
Click onLinearand follow the instructions in Notion to start the connection.Keep Notion open during this process!
Click onLinearand follow the instructions in Notion to start the connection.Keep Notion open during this process!
You will be redirected to Linear to select team access. ClickAuthorize.
You will be redirected to Linear to select team access. ClickAuthorize.
Click through the installation. If successful, you'll be redirected to Notion and see a modal on your screen indicating that you‚Äôre done! If not, navigate back to Notion and click Check connection to complete your setup.
Click through the installation. If successful, you'll be redirected to Notion and see a modal on your screen indicating that you‚Äôre done! If not, navigate back to Notion and click Check connection to complete your setup.
You're done!The connection can take up to 36 hours.You can manage the connection in Notion AI settings by clicking the gear icon onLinearat any time.

FAQs
What data does Notion AI get access to?
Notion AI can read all projects and issues details including the title, assignee, creator and all issue comments. However, project progress, and milestones are not supported at this time.
Does Notion AI respect my Linear permissions?
Absolutely. Notion AI will honor permissions according to their role in Linear. Users will not be able to generate content or receive responses based on resources they do not have access to. For more information, referenceNotion AI Security Practices.
How long does it take for the integration to complete and how far back does it look?
Depending on the workspace size, the integration can take up to 36 hours to complete. Once the integration is set up, Notion AI will only be able to reference: issues updated within the last year, the latest 50 comments and labels, the last 10 cycles for each team, the recent 5 updates for each project, and 5 recent comments for each project update on initial connection. Subsequent comments, labels and project updates will be updated immediately after.
Are attachments and documents ingested by Notion AI?
Not at this time.
How do I change my teams selection? How long does it take to reflect the changes?
Change your team selection directly in Linear settings or navigate to the Linear AI Connector by going toSettings‚ÜíNotion AI‚ÜíLinearin the AI Connectors section. Click on the gear icon and this will re-direct you into the settings page in Linear to edit application settings.
Changes should be reflected within the hour.
How long does it take for Notion AI to read updates in Linear?
Notion AI reads updates every 30 minutes through webhooks.
Can I limit the scope of my search to only Linear?
Yes! In the Notion AI, clickAll sourcesto toggle betweenEverything you can access,Notion, andLinear.
Who can access Linear content using Notion AI?
You must be both a Linear user and a Notion workspace member to use this integration. Notion AI automatically maps Linear members to their corresponding Notion accounts by email address. The system syncs permission changes every hour
How can I disconnect Linear from Notion?
Workspace owners can disconnect Linear by opening Notion AI setting, clicking the gear icon onLinear, then clickingDisconnect. Linear admins can disconnect in Linear by navigating to Settings > Applications > Select app > Revoke access
How do the permission settings work?
Individuals who are both a Linear member and a Notion workspace member can use this integration. Notion AI maps Linear members to Notion members through emails and conducts ongoing checks for changes to permissions and access levels that would impact the Linear content surfaced in Notion AI for each individual.

Who can connect SharePoint and OneDrive to Notion AI?
How do I connect SharePoint and OneDrive?
Best practices and example prompts
The SharePoint and OneDrive AI connector is a single Microsoft app and integration that gives Notion AI access to both SharePoint and OneDrive data.
This integration enables powerful search and analysis across your stored files, making it simple to find company policies, analyze project documentation, and process Excel data.
The SharePoint and OneDrive AI connector is currently in beta and subject to the beta terms of your agreement.
Who can connect SharePoint and OneDrive to Notion AI?
To connect SharePoint and OneDrive to Notion AI:
You must be a Microsoft 365 Admin and Notion workspace owner.
You must be a Microsoft 365 Admin and Notion workspace owner.
You must be on a Business or Enterprise Plan.
You must be on a Business or Enterprise Plan.
Permissions for specific content will follow Microsoft ‚Äì users will only see content they have access to.
How do I connect SharePoint and OneDrive?
To connect SharePoint and OneDrive to your Notion workspace:
In Notion, go toSettings‚ÜíNotion AI‚Üí clickConnectunderSharePoint and OneDrive.
In Notion, go toSettings‚ÜíNotion AI‚Üí clickConnectunderSharePoint and OneDrive.
You'll be taken to Microsoft Teams.Don't close Notion during the setup process!

FAQs
What data does Notion AI get access to?
Notion AI can read DOCX, XLSX, PPTX, and PDF files, but it cannot currently read SharePoint site pages.
Does Notion AI respect my SharePoint and OneDrive permissions?
Yes. Notion AI strictly follows existing permissions as outlined in ourNotion AI Security Practices.
Users can only access and generate content for resources they have permission to view.
For third-party content, Notion AI manages permissions by processing information solely based on the access rights established between Microsoft and Notion users.
How long does it take for the integration to complete and how far back does it look?
Once the integration is set up, it will be able to find documents created or viewed up to one year before the setup completion.
Depending on the amount of content during this timeframe, the process can take up to 36 hours.
How long does it take for Notion AI to read new SharePoint and OneDrive content?
New content added to SharePoint or OneDrive updates hourly and becomes available in Notion AI searches.
Can I limit the scope of my search to only SharePoint and OneDrive?
Yes! In the Notion AI, clickFind into toggle betweenEverything you can access,Notion, andSharePoint and OneDrive.
Who can access Microsoft SharePoint content using Notion AI?
You must be both a Microsoft SharePoint/OneDrive user and a Notion workspace member to use this integration.
Notion AI automatically maps Microsoft members to their corresponding Notion accounts.
The system syncs content updates and permission changes from SharePoint/OneDrive every hour.
How does Notion store or reference my SharePoint and OneDrive data in its systems?
SharePoint and OneDrive data is stored as embeddings using vector databases like Turbopuffer. These embeddings allow for efficient searches and comparisons across different pieces of text to provide accurate and relevant responses to your questions.
Notion‚Äôs vector databases have been vetted by our Security team as well as by an external auditor to obtain their SOC2 Type II certification. Seethis articlefor more information.
Can I add connect multiple Notion workspaces to my SharePoint/OneDrive?
Not at this time. The workspace admin will only be able to connect one Notion workspace to one Microsoft Tenant.
How can I disconnect my SharePoint and OneDrive from Notion?
Workspace owners can disconnect SharePoint and OneDrive by opening Notion AI at the bottom right of Notion and clicking on‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚ÜíConnect SharePoint and OneDrive‚ÜíSettings‚ÜíDisconnect.
What happens to my SharePoint and OneDrive data if I disconnect?
Notion handles your SharePoint and OneDrive data following strict data minimization principles.
When you disconnect SharePoint and OneDrive from Notion AI, your content becomes unsearchable immediately. All associated data is then deleted within 24 hours of your disconnection request.

‚Üê Notion AI
Notion AI connector for Microsoft Teams (beta)
Connect Notion AI to Microsoft Teams to keep all your work in context.
Who can connect Microsoft Teams to Notion AI?
How do I connect Microsoft Teams?
Best practices and example prompts
The Microsoft Teams AI Connector transforms collaboration by integrating AI into your daily workflow. This powerful tool lets you track project updates, search team discussions, access admin communications, and get automatic meeting summaries‚Äîall from within Teams.
The Microsoft Teams connector is currently in beta and subject to the beta terms of your agreement.
Who can connect Microsoft Teams to Notion AI?
To connect Microsoft Teams to Notion AI, you must be:
A Microsoft Teams admin.
A Microsoft Teams admin.
A Notion workspace owner.
A Notion workspace owner.
You must be on Notion‚Äôs Business or Enterprise Plan.
You must be on Notion‚Äôs Business or Enterprise Plan.
Permissions for specific content will follow Microsoft ‚Äì users will only see content they have access to.
How do I connect Microsoft Teams?
To connect Microsoft Teams to your Notion workspace:
In Notion, navigate to the the Microsoft Teams AI Connector by going toSettings‚ÜíNotion AI‚ÜíMicrosoft Teamsin the AI Connectors section.
In Notion, navigate to the the Microsoft Teams AI Connector by going toSettings‚ÜíNotion AI‚ÜíMicrosoft Teamsin the AI Connectors section.

Best practices and example prompts
The Microsoft Teams connector is most helpful for:

FAQs
How long does the Microsoft Teams connection take to complete, and what message history can it access?
The integration can access messages dating back one year from the setup date.
For example, if you connect Microsoft Teams with Notion AI on June 1, 2024, you'll have access to messages from June 1, 2023 onward.
The initial setup can take up to 36 hours to complete, depending on how much content exists in your public channels.
How long does it take for Notion AI to read new Teams messages?
New messages in public channels become searchable within 30 minutes.
Can I limit the scope of my search to only Microsoft Teams or only Notion?
Yes! In the Notion AI entry point, click Find in to toggle between Everything you can access, Notion, and Microsoft Teams.
If I connect Microsoft Teams to Notion AI, which channels does Notion AI read?
By default, Notion AI syncs all private (1:1 and group chats), public, and shared channels in the selected teams.
During setup, Notion workspace owners can choose which specific teams to sync‚Äîincluding future teams. This requires approval from both the Notion workspace owner and Microsoft Teams admin.
Who can access Microsoft Teams content using Notion AI?
Only users who are members of both Microsoft Teams and the Notion workspace can use this integration. Notion AI synchronizes member permissions between platforms and monitors access changes in real time through account mapping and event subscriptions.
Here are examples of how permissions are managed:
Users added to a private Multi DM can only access chat content from their join date forward, regardless of earlier message history in Microsoft Teams.
Users added to a private Multi DM can only access chat content from their join date forward, regardless of earlier message history in Microsoft Teams.
Users removed from a private Multi DM can only access messages from when they were active members during the Teams-Notion AI connection.
Users removed from a private Multi DM can only access messages from when they were active members during the Teams-Notion AI connection.
Message edits or deletions in Microsoft Teams sync instantly through webhooks.
Message edits or deletions in Microsoft Teams sync instantly through webhooks.
Guest users in either Microsoft Teams or Notion cannot use Notion AI. When a guest becomes a full member in both platforms, their permissions update automatically.
Guest users in either Microsoft Teams or Notion cannot use Notion AI. When a guest becomes a full member in both platforms, their permissions update automatically.
Team removal triggers immediate permission updates.
Team removal triggers immediate permission updates.

What happens to messages when my team is added to a shared channel?
When a team joins a shared channel, members get immediate access to new messages. However, it may take up to 24 hours for older messages to become searchable.
If a team is removed from a shared channel, they immediately lose access to new messages but retain the ability to search older messages for 24 hours.
I have B2B direct connect channels set up with external users. Will these channels be indexed?
No, all external messages and channels are excluded.
How does Notion store or reference my Microsoft Teams data in its systems?
Microsoft Teams content is stored as embeddings in vector databases like Turbopuffer. These embeddings enable efficient text searches and comparisons to provide relevant responses to your questions.
Notion's vector databases have been vetted by our Security team and an external auditor to obtain SOC2 Type II certification. Seethis articlefor more information.
I connected the wrong Notion workspace. How can I disconnect my Microsoft Teams from Notion?
To disconnect Microsoft Teams, open Notion AI at the bottom of your screen and click on ‚ÜíConnect Microsoft Teams‚ÜíSettings‚ÜíDisconnect.
Upon disconnection, your Microsoft Teams content becomes immediately unsearchable, and all related data is deleted within one day of the request.

Notion AI
‚Üê Notion AI
Notion AI connectors
With Notion AI connectors, you can use Notion as a single place to find the information you need ‚Äî even if it lives outside your workspace üë£
What are Notion AI connectors?
Set up and manage Notion AI connectors
Limitations and best practices
FAQs

Note:This feature is only available for users on the Business Plan or Enterprise Plan.

Ready to get started with Notion AI connectors? You‚Äôll find app-specific information and instructionshere ‚Üí
What are Notion AI connectors?
Today,Notion AIenables you to ask any questions about the content in your Notion workspace. With Notion AI connectors, when you ask a question, Notion AI will also surface relevant information from your connected apps, citing specific sources it referenced.
Notion AI connectors are available for the following apps:

The Notion AI chat in the bottom right of Notion.

Set up and manage Notion AI connectors

Note:
To set up a Notion AI connector, you need to be the owner of your Notion workspace. You‚Äôll also need to have admin rights in the app that you‚Äôre trying to connect.
To set up a Notion AI connector, you need to be the owner of your Notion workspace. You‚Äôll also need to have admin rights in the app that you‚Äôre trying to connect.
Depending on how much content is in your connected app, it can take up to 72 hours for Notion AI connectors to ingest.
Depending on how much content is in your connected app, it can take up to 72 hours for Notion AI connectors to ingest.

Go toSettings‚ÜíNotion AIto manage all of your Notion AI connectors in one place. From here, you can:
See what apps you‚Äôve already connected.
See what apps you‚Äôve already connected.
Select‚öôÔ∏ènext to an existing connector to make adjustments to the connection or to disconnect.
Select‚öôÔ∏ènext to an existing connector to make adjustments to the connection or to disconnect.
Select+next to an app you haven‚Äôt yet set up to connect it.
Select+next to an app you haven‚Äôt yet set up to connect it.
Limitations and best practices
It‚Äôs important to understand what Notion AI is most helpful for, as well as what Notion AI might not be able to do. To make the most out of Notion AI connectors, make note of the following:
Notion AI connectors are best for finding and summarizing information. They‚Äôre not meant to run complex calculations or perform data analysis.
Notion AI connectors are best for finding and summarizing information. They‚Äôre not meant to run complex calculations or perform data analysis.
It‚Äôs best to ask specific questions about specific information in your apps. For example, you could ask Notion AI "Can you find me the action items from this thread?‚Äù with a link to a particular Slack conversation.
It‚Äôs best to ask specific questions about specific information in your apps. For example, you could ask Notion AI "Can you find me the action items from this thread?‚Äù with a link to a particular Slack conversation.
Notion AI might have a more difficult time with aggregating lots of information from an app or multiple apps.
Notion AI might have a more difficult time with aggregating lots of information from an app or multiple apps.

Each app has its own best practices, so make sure to read thearticles for each appyou want to connect to learn more.
Each app has its own best practices, so make sure to read thearticles for each appyou want to connect to learn more.
You can also pick up some prompting skills by readingthis guide ‚Üí
You can also pick up some prompting skills by readingthis guide ‚Üí

FAQs
Why connect third-party apps with Notion AI?
Notion AI enables you to ask any questions about the content in your Notion workspace. When you choose to connect third-party apps like Slack, Notion AI will also surface relevant information from those third-party data sources you enable, citing the specific messages it referenced.
Notion‚Äôs collection of AI products and features like third-party connections to Notion AI appear seamlessly in your workspace but leverage technology from several AI Subprocessors. Read ourNotion AI security and privacy practicesfor more information, as well as ourlist of subprocessors. Our goal is to protect your data and workspaces while allowing you to be more effective in your organizations.
Will my data be used to train Notion‚Äôs models?
No. We only process your Customer Data to provide the functionality. We do not process your Customer Data to train our models and do not allow our sub-processors to process your Customer Data to train their models. View ourterms and privacy pagesfor more information.
Are existing permissions respected when using Notion AI connectors?
Users will only be able to access third-party content that they had access to in the third-party service. Notion AI will not be able to answer users‚Äô questions based on data and content to which they do not have access. Notion AI manages third-party content (e.g., Slack) with security in mind, adhering to user permissions based both on the third-party application as well as in Notion AI.

Notion AI connector for Google Drive
Get answers from your Google Drive files without having to leave Notion üìÇ
Who can connect Google Drive to Notion AI?
How do I connect my Google Drive?

Best practices and example prompts
